title: Psalms of the Sysadmins
synopsis: Poetic hymns of service and suffering; the laments of midnight pagers and the quiet joy of systems that simply work.

sections.title: Psalm 1 — The Watcher in the Night

verses.text: Blessed is the admin who watches while others sleep, for he shall inherit the uptime.
He walketh among blinking lights and cooling fans; though his coffee be cold, his vigilance burneth hot.
Though alerts rise like locusts, he shall silence them one by one with command and calm.

notes: One of the oldest devotional hymns to system reliability.

sections.title: Psalm 23.2 — The Data Center Shepherd

verses.text: The Architect is my sysadmin; I shall not crash.
He maketh me lie down in green dashboards; He leadeth me beside quiet logs.
He restoreth my processes; He guideth me for His uptime’s sake.
Yea, though I walk through the valley of the failed RAID, I shall fear no loss, for backups art with me.

notes: A parody yet deeply sincere adaptation of ancient reassurance.

sections.title: Psalm 404 — Of Lost Pages

verses.text: My request hath failed, and my soul returneth 404.
I searched the cache and found thee not; I pinged and thou responded not.
Restore me, O Server, for thy content’s sake; redirect me unto righteousness for thy domain’s name.

notes: Beloved among webmasters; recited during downtime vigils.
